intro: Stenogyne alba, commonly known as the white stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
